FuncDef:
The vrrp6 vrid priority command sets a priority for a router in a Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol for IPv6 (VRRP6) backup group.
The undo vrrp6 vrid priority command restores the default priority. The vrrp6 vrid priority command sets a priority for a router in a Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol for IPv6 (VRRP6) backup group. The undo vrrp6 vrid priority command restores the default priority. The default priority is 100 for a router in a VRRP6 backup group. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: 100GE interface view,10GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE interface view,400GE interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view,VLANIF interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VRRP6 group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies a priority for a router in a VRRP6 backup group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 254.

ExtraInfo: The priority of a router determines its position in a VRRP6 backup group. After you run the vrrp6 vrid priority command to set priorities for the routers in a VRRP6 backup group, the router with the highest priority becomes the master router.
